items.content_html: Even if you don’t know it, you probably use @letsencrypt, a non-profit that provides over 200 million (!) TLS certificates to websites for free. I use them in my systems and donate, and hopefully you might too. 💝 letsencrypt.org/donate/

items.content_html: I’m a fan of Just Systems’ «ATOK Passport», which is the best way to enter Japanese on Mac, Windows, iOS, Android. It has too many features to mention, but suffice to say it’s really helpful even for a non-native Japanese speaker.
items.content_text: I'm a fan of Just Systems' «[ATOK Passport](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cDoRi-ra1d4)», which is the best way to enter Japanese on Mac, Windows, iOS, Android. It has too many features to mention, but suffice to say it's really helpful even for a non-native Japanese speaker.

items.content_html: After about 500km on my Altra One 3’s, I tried a bunch of new models and settled on Topo Magnifly 3. Love them; zero drop with just enough padding. New Altra misses the mark and I couldn’t get past the exaggerated padding of Hoka.
items.content_text: After about 500km on my Altra One 3’s, I tried a bunch of new models and settled on Topo Magnifly 3. Love them; zero drop with just enough padding. New Altra misses the mark and I couldn’t get past the exaggerated padding of Hoka.

items.content_html: If you use brew, upgrading to MacOS 11.0.1 Big Sur results in errors regarding “CLT” (Xcode’s Command Line Tools), with commands like brew upgrade. Fix this situation by deleting and reinstalling CLT. https://logr.cogley.info/2020/11/15/1605445406/
items.content_text: If you use `brew`, upgrading to MacOS 11.0.1 Big Sur results in errors regarding "CLT" (Xcode's Command Line Tools), with commands like `brew upgrade`. Fix this situation by deleting and reinstalling CLT. https://logr.cogley.info/2020/11/15/1605445406/

items.title: M1 chipped Apples limited
items.content_html: The new Macs with Apple’s M1 chips indeed “change everything” as Apple says. You cannot use more than 1 external display on the laptops, although you can use 2 on the Mini since there’s an hdmi port apparently. Is this a way to sell the eye-wateringly expensive Mac Pro to desktop users?
items.content_text: The new Macs with Apple's M1 chips indeed "change everything" as Apple says. You cannot use more than 1 external display on the laptops, although you can use 2 on the Mini since there's an hdmi port apparently. Is this a way to sell the eye-wateringly expensive Mac Pro to desktop users?

items.content_html: You can’t put a oily-cheesy pizza box in the paper recycling, but, you can compact it down quite small. Just wet the cardboard on both sides and fold it up, wetting as you fold, and wring it like a dishrag. It will get quite small. 🍕

items.content_html: PSA: in Japan for the RWC? Stay safe indoors, #TyphoonHagibis is the strongest one in 60 yr, peaking in Yokohama & Tokyo area ~21pm, w/ 51kt wind gusting to 90kt! That’s off the Beaufort scale. 🌀🇯🇵⚠️
items.content_text: PSA: in Japan for the RWC? Stay safe indoors, #TyphoonHagibis is the strongest one in 60 yr, peaking in Yokohama & Tokyo area ~21pm, w/ 51kt wind gusting to 90kt! That's [off the Beaufort scale](https://www.spc.noaa.gov/faq/tornado/beaufort.html). 🌀🇯🇵⚠️

items.content_html: If you’re in Japan, typhoon #Hagibis is bearing down on honshu island now, and should build from ~15pm thru 21pm, with gale force winds gusting to hurricane force. Unless you’re heading to an evac site, do not go outside unnecessarily. 🌀🇯🇵⚠️

items.content_html: Yokohama city just issued official warnings, and typhoon Hagibis has not even started really. Seya & Kanazawa are level 4 (sugoku yabai, hinan seyo), most others level 3 (kanari yabai) for flooding and landslide… ⚠️🇯🇵

items.content_html: As my wife and I were driving around the Torihamacho seaside area here, we saw great piles of sea detritus. Apparently this area was flooded in the recent typhoon, and we were seeing the result of flooding. Scary, because this is where our daughter’s work is.
items.content_text: As my wife and I were driving around the Torihamacho seaside area [here](https://goo.gl/maps/B8KbwFFvXD3SJhEu9), we saw great piles of sea detritus. Apparently this area was flooded in the recent typhoon, and we were seeing the result of flooding. Scary, because this is where our daughter's work is.

items.content_html: Akiko found her Hinamatsuri dolls, while tidying up. These are the “san-nin kanjo”, the three court ladies who serve sake and sweets. items.content_html: While tidying up, Akiko found her “Hinamatsuri” dolls. Here are three helper protectors, the “shicho” or “eji”. You can see their expressions are slightly different: they represent the crying drinker “nakijogo”, angry drinker “okorijogo” and laughing drinker “waraijogo”.

items.content_html: June 18th is onigiri day in Japan. The 6th month was chosen because a fossilized Yayoi period rice ball was found in Rokusei-machi, in Ishikawa, and “roku” rhymes with 6. The 18 comes from the kanji “kome” 米, which broken down, looks like 10 and 8. 🍙

items.content_html: Individual privacy has an inherent and great value. Don’t fall prey to the specious, stupidly self-deprecating and dangerous argument “if you’re not doing anything wrong you’ve nothing to hide.”

items.content_html: A “comedy” duo called Fujisaki Market, probes someone’s gender and sexuality on a show “Kansai Joho Net Ten”, and Yomiuri Telecasting has apologized. Insensitive, cruel and not even remotely funny. 深く反省しろ。

items.content_html: Always wondered who is the soothing voice of most of the English announcements on Japan’s trains, but now I know: it’s Christelle Ciari @christelleciari. “The next stop will ↗️, be ↗️, Totsuka, JT6.” 😊 Her voice is a big part of my day.
items.content_text: Always wondered who is the soothing voice of most of the English announcements on Japan's trains, but now I know: it's [Christelle Ciari](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WuFEIf5IOfA) @christelleciari. "The next stop will ↗️, be ↗️, Totsuka, JT6." 😊 Her voice is a big part of my day.

items.content_html: Heard about a Florida man who recently got killed by his Cassowary bird. These are large (as big as a person), territorial birds native to NE Australia and Papua New Guinea, that can become aggressive and can do real damage with their ~125mm claws if they kick you.
items.content_text: Heard about a Florida man who recently got killed by his [Cassowary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cassowary) bird. These are large (as big as a person), territorial birds native to NE Australia and Papua New Guinea, that can become aggressive and can do real damage with their ~125mm claws if they kick you.

items.content_html: There’s an old kimono shop near my office, «Choujiya», which is 221 years old. Founded in Kansei 10 (寛政10年) or 1798, they opened the Toranomon shop in Meiji 35 (明治35年) or 1903. A real “shinise”. I bought a couple “tenugui” utility cloths there. 👘🇯🇵
items.content_text: There's an old kimono shop near my office, «[Choujiya](https://www.choujiya-toranomon.co.jp)», which is 221 years old. Founded in Kansei 10 (寛政10年) or 1798, they opened the Toranomon shop in Meiji 35 (明治35年) or 1903. A real "shinise". I bought a couple "tenugui" utility cloths there. 👘🇯🇵

items.content_html: If you’re near JR Shimbashi station and want a cheap but good coffee, visit «TENTOSHI». It’s an interesting little shop and you can get an iced or hot coffee for 100 yen at the standing bar. ☕️

items.content_html: I’ve been in Japan since the end of Showa and through Heisei. Japan’s new era name is “Reiwa” 令和, which is from the Manyoshu per PM Abe’s explanation. To me it sounds so regressive and inward turning.
items.content_text: I’ve been in Japan since the end of Showa and through Heisei. Japan's new era name is "Reiwa" 令和, which is from the Manyoshu per PM Abe's explanation. To me it sounds so regressive and inward turning.

items.content_html: Sakura and plum blossoms both have five petals. But you can see the notch at the end of the sakura petals and they overlap more. Plum petals are round with no notch, and don’t overlap much.

items.content_text: There's been a spate of racist behavior from gov't officials in Japan lately, including from former pension service branch head [Yukihisa Kasai](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/03/26/national/japan-pension-branch-head-replaced-hate-speech-tweets/#.XJncnIbBkdo.twitter) who wants Korean residents purged from Japan. items.content_html: About this time 8 years ago, we were trying to drive out of Tokyo. That was simply impossible. We gave up after hours, found a place to eat, then turned back around and headed in. Was going to buy a bicycle, but it was too cold and the price was double. #fukushima

items.content_html: Eight years ago at about 14:46 on 11th March 2011, Tohoku Japan got hit with a massive earthquake and tsunami. Our thoughts are with them as they still rebuild even today. Please have a look at our web pages for Disaster Preparedness, and install an app like NHK World TV, that will give you multilingual information in case of a disaster. 💓
items.content_text: Eight years ago at about 14:46 on 11th March 2011, Tohoku Japan got hit with a massive earthquake and tsunami. Our thoughts are with them as they still rebuild even today. Please have a look at our web pages for [Disaster Preparedness](https://esolia.com/japan-disaster/), and install an app like NHK World TV, that will give you multilingual information in case of a disaster. 💓

items.content_html: Int’l Womens’ Day is not big in Japan, but we celebrate Hinamatsuri on 3 March, a day of hoping for girls health & happiness, bringing out hina dolls, eating chirashi sushi. Japan should do more about womens’ equality.

items.content_html: The Citan hostel is in East Nihonbashi (closer to Tokyo station and convenient to Asakusa/Ueno or Ginza), and has a good communal coffee space, food, various room types and music.
items.content_text: The [Citan](https://backpackersjapan.co.jp/citan/en) hostel is in East Nihonbashi (closer to Tokyo station and convenient to Asakusa/Ueno or Ginza), and has a good communal coffee space, food, various room types and music.

items.content_html: The Almond Hostel & Cafe near Yoyogi Park (itself near Shibuya Tokyo) seems like a good option for budget conscious travelers or young people. They seem to focus on security (a worry at hostels; there’s even a womens’ floor) & have good coffee.
items.content_text: The [Almond Hostel & Cafe](https://almondhostelandcafe.tokyo/en/) near Yoyogi Park (itself near Shibuya Tokyo) seems like a good option for budget conscious travelers or young people. They seem to focus on security (a worry at hostels; there’s even a womens' floor) & have good coffee.

items.content_html: Tokyo is going to install surveillance at the 2020 games (& already are in subway cars). Wonder what will happen if people try avoiding the cameras like that poor schlub in London, and, how it will work with the ubiquitous surgical masks! Or is it for gaijin only?!
items.content_text: Tokyo is going to [install surveillance](https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2019/02/09/national/olympic-organizers-install-latest-surveillance-system-2020-games/) at the 2020 games (& already are in subway cars). Wonder what will happen if people try avoiding the cameras like that poor schlub in London, and, how it will work with the ubiquitous surgical masks! Or is it for gaijin only?!

items.title: JR Sui-sui Suica Card lets you swim like a Penguin
items.content_html: JR’s IC rail pass “Suica” is so named because it helps daily commuters pass through gates easily, i.e. in a “Sui-Sui” manner, since 2001. Penguins are skillful swimmers, passing in and around obstacles with ease, so that’s why the “Suica Penguin” mascot was born. Its designer is the lovely Chiharu Sakazaki 坂崎千春, who modeled it after an Adélie penguin. Ironically, people shuffling towards escalators during rush hour, walk a lot like penguins. 🐧🚅
items.content_text: JR’s IC rail pass "[Suica]([www.jreast.co.jp/suica/sui...](http://www.jreast.co.jp/suica/suica_penguin_goods/) "Japan Rail Suica Penguin Goods Page")" is so named because it helps daily commuters pass through gates easily, i.e. in a "Sui-Sui" manner, since 2001. Penguins are skillful swimmers, passing in and around obstacles with ease, so that’s why the "Suica Penguin" mascot was born. Its designer is the lovely [Chiharu Sakazaki 坂崎千春]([www.sakazakichiharu.com/about.htm...](http://www.sakazakichiharu.com/about.html) "Chiharu Sakazaki About Page"), who modeled it after an Adélie penguin. Ironically, people shuffling towards escalators during rush hour, walk a lot like penguins. 🐧🚅

items.title: Nissan board: who us?
items.content_html: Nissan’s a huge company, not a corner mom-and-pop, so Ghosn being put forward as the primary evildoer as he rots in detention, and the innocent “who me” looks and whistling of the rest of the board (Japanese folks, don’t you know), is wildly disingenuous. Ghosn barely even speaks Japanese.

items.title: Friday, November 2, 2018 13:00
items.content_html: 11月3日は文化の日。この日は日本国憲法が交付された日で、この憲法が自由と平和に基づく文化国家の建設を理想としていることから「文化の日」とされました。元々は明治天皇の御誕生日を祝うための日でしたが、第二次世界大戦後に文化の日とされました。
items.content_text: 11月3日は文化の日。この日は日本国憲法が交付された日で、この憲法が自由と平和に基づく文化国家の建設を理想としていることから「文化の日」とされました。元々は明治天皇の御誕生日を祝うための日でしたが、第二次世界大戦後に文化の日とされました。

items.title: Friday, November 2, 2018 13:00
items.content_html: Nov 3 is “Culture Day” in Japan. Once Emperor Meiji’s birthday, the post-WWII constitution was promulgated on this day, so it is now a day to celebrate peace and culture.

items.content_html: 警報:台風トラミー(Trami)は本日9月30日18時頃から日本東京エリアに上陸する予定です。JR東日本山手線など首都圏のJR在来線 午後8時以降はすべて運転を取りやめ。災害対策処置を取り、不要・不急な外出や旅行を控えてください。

items.content_html: 警報シリーズ: ランサムウェア(Ransomware)の感染回避ヒント1/6。ランサムウエアはマルウェアの一種で、インストールされたコンピューターのファイルを暗号化します。ファイルを元に戻す唯一の方法はインストールした犯罪者に、ビットコインまたは別の暗号通貨で代金支払います。第一線の防衛策としては、データの有効なバックアップを維持することです。
items.content_text: 警報シリーズ: ランサムウェア(Ransomware)の感染回避ヒント1/6。ランサムウエアはマルウェアの一種で、インストールされたコンピューターのファイルを暗号化します。ファイルを元に戻す唯一の方法はインストールした犯罪者に、ビットコインまたは別の暗号通貨で代金支払います。第一線の防衛策としては、データの有効なバックアップを維持することです。

items.content_html: Pretty terra cotta colored house in #totsuka #yokohama #japan. One thing you see in Japan that you might not see elsewhere, is a lot of laundry hanging out. People like to conserve electricity and hang laundry when possible, as well as their futons (you put it over the veranda rail). I hear that when Japanese go to other countries and hang their laundry out, it’s often complained about. What’s the status in your country? Do people hang out laundry?

items.content_html: #Anpanman playground equipment in #Yokohama #Japan. Anpanman is a superhero, who lets the weak or hungry eat part of his bean-jam-bun (anpan) head when they call him (he has great hearing and can hear anyone in the world), and can deliver a mighty an-punch or an-kick to his mortal enemy “baikin man” (bacteria man). The creator came up with Anpanman, apparently after starving in WWII and dreaming of bean jam buns. Anpanman’s weakness? Water or moistness. When his head gets wet, he gets weak. But never fear, Uncle Jam will bake him a new head in no time. We watched this show so many times with our daughters that I can sing the songs by heart.

items.content_html: This work qualifies as what they call “3K” (san k) for, kitanai kitsui kiken (dirty, hard, dangerous). The operators were pumping out the sewer and it really, really stank just passing by. I cannot imaging what they felt, working with those fumes in their faces…and the young fella looked particularly glum, like “I didn’t sign up for this”. #shimbashi #tokyo

items.content_html:
In #Japan, elementary school kids conduct interviews with shopkeepers, to learn a bit about what their jobs are like. Here’s a class visiting a fishmonger, in #Totsuka #Yokohama. I remember our daughters did this.

A neat aspect is all the signs, saying what kind of fish is available and that it’s “direct from Misaki” which is the tip of the Miura Peninsula near where the Yokosuka military base is. Also, to the front right, you can get raw oysters and “OK to eat them standing right here!” I think I’ll try it next time.

items.content_html: Totsuka high school had their school matsuri festival (called gakusai or bunkasai 学祭、文化祭), with this pretty “washi” papered entrance prepared especially for the day. Kids put on skits and do activities all day, and it’s attended by alums, parents, teachers, friends. The ones our girls did at their school were always a lot of fun. The character you can see on the gate looks like “wa” (和), or peace/harmony. It’s kind of meta, with the right part of the character morphing into a circle, also a symbol for harmony and togetherness. #hope

items.content_html: Yokohama Shindo Highway Entrance at Kamiyabe. The “30” is a speed limit sign. You can see the highway sign is bilingual, which is nice. Highways here in Japan are well kept, but expensive to use. Random point: some car navigator systems here, can be set to speak a couple different Japanese dialects. It’s pretty hysterical.

items.content_html: A totem clock designating a kids play area called “AQUA Land” along the Akuwa River (阿久和川). The name’s a little gag. There were indeed a bunch of kids in the river playing, which was good to see. There are also signs warning of flooding if it rains. That’s totally true, the rivers around here get really rough during the rain.

items.content_html: This bamboo grove behind our house grows so fast, and we can only cut so much. It was getting out of hand, so we hired a team to come cut it. Five people over one day, throwing the trees directly into a garbage truck was what had to happen, to get rid of half the grove. 家の裏の竹林が結構ワイルドで、我々だけじゃ、処分仕切れなくて、とうとうプロに頼んだ。５人が１日作業をし、チェーンソーで切って、直接ゴミトラックに捨てても、半分の処分。大変だったけど、すっきり。
items.content_text: This bamboo grove behind our house grows so fast, and we can only cut so much. It was getting out of hand, so we hired a team to come cut it. Five people over one day, throwing the trees directly into a garbage truck was what had to happen, to get rid of half the grove. 家の裏の竹林が結構ワイルドで、我々だけじゃ、処分仕切れなくて、とうとうプロに頼んだ。５人が１日作業をし、チェーンソーで切って、直接ゴミトラックに捨てても、半分の処分。大変だったけど、すっきり。
